meanings.definition: To mark or brand with a stigma
meanings.sent1: She was stigmatizing the paper with a red stamp.
meanings.sent2: The society was stigmatizing those who didn't follow the rules.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly accused his friend of stigmatizing his favorite book.
meanings.sent4: The rumor quickly spread, stigmatizing her reputation like a scarlet letter.
meanings.sent5: The image of the vandal stigmatizing the wall was hard to forget.

meanings.definition: To characterize or brand as disgraceful or shameful
meanings.sent1: The media was stigmatizing the politician's actions.
meanings.sent2: People should not stigmatize others based on their appearance.
meanings.sent3: The comedian playfully stigmatized his own fashion sense.
meanings.sent4: Her words stigmatized him in front of the whole class.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed the villain as stigmatizing the innocent character.

meanings.definition: To cause to be viewed negatively by society
meanings.sent1: The controversial article was stigmatizing the author's credibility.
meanings.sent2: The false accusations were stigmatizing the defendant.
meanings.sent3: The cat's behavior seemed to stigmatize its owner in a funny way.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed to stigmatize the once peaceful town.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti on the monument was stigmatizing the historical figure.
